msgSnippet: ... Sorry for the confusion.  I was talking about object instances all along. And this problem can be compounded in TestNG by @Test(invocationCount = 1000),
messageBody:
On 1/20/06, David Saff <saff@...> wrote:
>
> I'm a little confused by the TestNG description above. Are you saying
> that you saved memory by lazily classloading? Loading lots of classes
> can be a memory drain--all Java programs have this issue--but I had
> assumed that the goal was reducing the amount of data, not classes, in
> memory.


Sorry for the confusion. I was talking about object instances all along.

And this problem can be compounded in TestNG by @Test(invocationCount =
1000), which creates 1000 instances of that test (one for each invocation).

--
Cédric
http://testng.org
